title: How to Open a New Window in a Web Browser

steps.title: Right click on the link on your current window.
steps.content: Right click on the link on your current window.

steps.title: Choose Open in New Window.
steps.content: Choose Open in New Window . The page will open in a new window. Alternatively, you can pick Open in New Tab if you want it to open in a new tab within your window.

steps.title: Find the link you want to click or enter the web address you want in your URL bar.
steps.content: Find the link you want to click or enter the web address you want in your URL bar. Don't click or press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return yet.

steps.title: Hold down your ⇧ Shift (Mac) or ⇧ Shift (Windows) button.
steps.content: Hold down your ⇧ Shift (Mac) or ⇧ Shift (Windows) button. If you want to open the link in a new background tab, hold ⌘ Cmd (Mac) or Ctrl (Windows) instead. If you want to open the link in a new foreground tab, hold both ⌘ Cmd + ⇧ Shift or Ctrl + ⇧ Shift (Windows) instead.

steps.title: As you hold the button, click the link you want to go to, or press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: As you hold the button, click the link you want to go to, or press ↵ Enter . This will open it in a new window.

steps.title: Locate and click the File option in your browser menu.
steps.content: Locate and click the File option in your browser menu. This is generally at the top of your browser window.

steps.title: Select New Window.
steps.content: Select New Window . The wording may vary on different browsers, but in general you'll see an option for both opening a New Tab and opening a New Window , so select whichever suits your needs.

steps.title: Wait for the new window/tab to load up.
steps.content: Wait for the new window/tab to load up. Then enter the URL you want to go to in the address bar and click ↵ Enter (Windows) or ⏎ Return (Mac) to load the new web page.

steps.title: Look for the "add new tab" icon at the top of your browser.
steps.content: Look for the "add new tab" icon at the top of your browser. In general, this is near the URL text box and either looks like a small tab or has a plus sign, but the exact appearance will depend on your browser. In Chrome, it resembles a blank box, and in Safari and Firefox it has a plus sign on it.

steps.title: Click the button.
steps.content: Click the button. You'll see a blank page.

steps.title: Enter the URL of the page you want to see in the address bar.
steps.content: Enter the URL of the page you want to see in the address bar.

steps.title: Click ↵ Enter (Windows) or ⏎ Return (Mac).
steps.content: Click ↵ Enter (Windows) or ⏎ Return (Mac). You'll see the desired page load up.
